answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Plantar fasciitis should be looked into and strange feelings can also be due to diabetes and hypothyroidism. Unaccostomed exercise as you are doing now could also have precipitated it.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Take care!
go to the Doctor and drink alot of water.Pray and God Bless you.Stay off your feet.
Maybe you pulled the muscle in the bottom of your foot? I've done that numerous times. But I agree that you should go see the doctor just to make sure.

question: I recently began  running after not having done so for some time and after several runs - admittedly longer than was wise - I noticed that as I walk I feel like something is moving around under my left foot in the midfoot area.  The feeling of movement occurs primarily when my heel has just left the ground and lasts until the foot is at an angle of about 30 degrees.  The sensation is not painful and there are no noticeable changes in the foots capabilities or structure, though it feels like the arch is slightly lower to the ground. Any thoughts?Your help is very much appreciated.
title: Midfoot strangeness
